item.title: Bayesian vs Frequentist Approach
item.description: To answer your question, we have to step into the shoes of a Frequentist and see the world through their lensâ€”a lens of cold, hard repetition. Your intuition that frequency might be a “trap” touches on one of the deepest debates in the philosophy of science: The Problem of Induction.The Frequentist Fortress: Reliability through RepetitionIn a frequentist universe, “probability” doesn’t exist for a single event (like a single coin flip). It only exists as the long-run limit. If you flip a coin 10 times, you might get 8 heads. But if you flip it 10,000,000 times, the frequency settles toward 0.5.1.
